lead_paragraph: The cases, involving Miami-Dade County, represent the first documented instances of local transmission by bug bite for the mainland United States.

byline.contributor: Nick Madigan and Sabrina Tavernise contributed reporting.
byline.original: By PAM BELLUCK, LIZETTE ALVAREZ and DONALD G. McNEIL Jr

headline.print_headline: 4 Zika Cases in Florida Are First Tied to Local Mosquitoes
headline.main: 4 Zika Cases in Florida Were Likely Spread by Local Mosquitoes, C.D.C. Says

snippet: The cases, involving Miami-Dade County, represent the first documented instances of local transmission by bug bite for the mainland United States....
abstract: Florida's Dept of Health says four Zika cases in state were likely result of patients contracting infection directly from mosquitoes, first documented cases of local transmission in continental United States.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
